_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: Amonia sensors shut down the system
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: All equipment is new - Pre stat up inspection on all equipment
_prev_prog_3.Description:
AmeriCold Logistics, L.L.C. established a Process Safety Management (PSM) Program at this facility in May 22, 2002.  The PSM program includes all of the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program elements.  These elements and how they satisfy both the PSM and RMP regulations are shown in Table 1.

    TABLE 1  Prevention Program Compliance Matrix

Prevention Program     OSHA PSM Subsection    EPA RMP Subsection
A) Employee Participation    1910.119 (c)    40 CFR Part 68.83
B) Process Safety Information    1910.119 (d)    40 CFR Part 68.65
C) Process Hazard Analysis    1910.119 (e)    40 CFR Part 68.67
D) Operating Procedures    1910.119 (f)    40 CFR Part 68.69
E) Training     1910.119 (g)    40 CFR Part 68.71
F) Contractors    1910.119 (h)    40 CFR Part 68.87
G) Pre-Startup Safety Review    1910.119 (i)    40 CFR Part 68.77
H) Mechanical Integrity    1910.119 (j)    40 CFR Part 68.73
I) Hot Work Permit    1910.119 (k)    40 CFR Part 68.85
J) Management of Change    1910.119 (l)    40 CFR Part 68.75
K) Incident Investigation    1910.119 (m)    40 CFR Part 68.81
L) Emergency Planning & Response    1910.119 (n)                   40 CFR Part 68.
M) Compliance Audits    1910.119 (o)    40 CFR Part 68.79

The prevention program elements included in Table 1 are detailed in the AmeriCold Logistics, L.L.C. Plant 75174 (Murfreesboro), Murfreesboro, TN. facility Process Safety Management notebook.  This document is maintained by the Facility Service Manager.  In addition to the Process Safety Management notebook, the Facility Service Manager maintains a Piping Diagram and IIAR Form notebook.  This book includes the piping diagrams for each piece of ammonia refrigeration equipment as well as the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration Bulletin 109 forms.  These forms include physical as well as operational data for each piece of ammonia refrigeration equipment.Americold Logistics, LLC establishes a Process Safety Management (PSM) progeam at this facility in May 22, 2002. The PSM program includes all of the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program elements.  These elements and how they satisfy both PSM and RMP.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
On May 22, 2002, in preparation for the opening of the new AmeriCold Logistics freezer storage facility at 720 Butler Drive, Murfreesboro TN, the Process Safety Management (PSM) and Risk Management Planning (RMP) programs were reviewed and  implemented.

Upon completion of the PSM, the RMP program was formulated.  The RMP team (Mike Walker, David Bryant and Mike Elliott who are all knowledgeable in the process) found the facility and its construction to be in compliance with PSM and RMP.  The Process Hazard analysis was reviewed and found to be in order.  The 13 elements of the PSM program were reviewed (audited) and found to be in good order.  Ammonia release scenarios were formulated for worst  and an alternate case scenarios; the findings were for the alternate case scenario  with a release of 6000 pounds in 60 minutes, the distance to the toxic end point is .19 miles and affects a population 17 residents and three commercial receptors.  The worst case scenario consisted of a 4,321 pound release for 10 minutes, the toxic end point is .30 miles, effects 43 residents, and 3 commercial receptors.
